name: dfifp2
params: wff w0, wff w1, wff w2
body: |- wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(wn(w0), w2)))

stmt.origin: bitri(wif(w0, w1, w2), wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(wn(w0), w2)), wo(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), w2)))

body.origin:
|- wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(wn(w0), w2)))
-| wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wo(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), w2)))
-| wb(wo(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), w2)), wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(wn(w0), w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(wn(w0), w2)))
-| wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wo(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), w2)))
-| wb(wo(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), w2)), wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(wn(w0), w2)))

body.origin: |- wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wo(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(wn(w0), w2)))
-| wb(wo(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), w2)), wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(wn(w0), w2)))

body.origin: |- wb(wo(wa(w0, w1), wa(wn(w0), w2)), wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(wn(w0), w2)))

cumulated.origin: |- wb(wif(w0, w1, w2), wa(wi(w0, w1), wi(wn(w0), w2)))

comment: Alternate definition of the conditional operator for propositions. The value of ` if- ( ph , ps , ch ) ` is "if ` ph ` then ` ps ` , and if not ` ph ` then ` ch ` ". This version of the definition uses only primitive symbols ( ` -> , -. , A. ` ). This is the definition used in Section II.24 of [Church] p. 129 (Definition D12 page 132) (see comment of ~ df-ifp ). (Contributed by BJ, 22-Jun-2019.)
